lines.text: I deeply regret the necessity for this flogging.
Thank you, sir. I don't think the flogger needed to have carried it out with such gusto.
You requested the customary lashing.
I know, sir. Of course, you could have done me the favor of denying it. I swear he took a particular pleasure in having an officer under his cat.
Should you fail, you'll look back on flogger Flower's lashing as a pleasant afternoon's pastime.
If only I had as much of the game as you give me the name.
Brave men are not forgotten.
Thank you, but sometimes they don't live long enough to be remembered.

[to Hawke]
I don't like the cut of your sail.
Belike you'll tell the truth now.
[He throws razor on his left]
You best speak the truth or the carrion will feed on your guts before the sun sets.

[Frightened]
I took no bounty.
[Roc throws a knife on his right side]

[Holding a third blade]
Now place the truth on your tongue, or I will place this knife between the other two.
I kiss when I feel like it, Hawke, and see that you remember that!
You'rea regular rooster, aren't you?
And why not, Madam? You seem to be a high-spirited chick yourself.

[Threatening]
I'm giving you fair warning, Hawke!

[Unconcerned]
That's very generous of you, Captain. I'll give it the fair attention it deserves.

[to Hawke about his new, beautiful wife]
Now that I got her, what does I do with her?
My father taught me howt o defend myself against rough men, but he told me he could only warn me about gentlemen.

[to Spitfire]
Well, Lass, in a minute it'll be Genoa or the devil with us.
